thread.title: Valentine's Day, so lucrative for businesses, has a naughty history
thread.title_full: Valentine's Day, so lucrative for businesses, has a naughty history

author: David Lazarus
title: Valentine's Day, so lucrative for businesses, has a naughty history
text:
Valentine's Day, so lucrative for businesses, has a naughty history Lupercalia Getty Images Historians trace Valentine's Day, and this year's $18.2 billion in consumer spending, to a Roman fertility festival, as represented in this detail from Thomas Couture's "The Romans of the Decadence." Historians trace Valentine's Day, and this year's $18.2 billion in consumer spending, to a Roman fertility festival, as represented in this detail from Thomas Couture's "The Romans of the Decadence." (Getty Images) David Lazarus Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss 
Adele's big night at the Grammys , an overflowing dam threatens homes in Northern California , Santa Monica is set to approve the nation’s most extensive seismic retrofit plan , and L.A. Metro officials continue to be vexed by falling ridership . Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss Caption Grammys 2017: Best moments 
Highlights from the 2017 Grammy Awards at the Staples Center. 
Highlights from the 2017 Grammy Awards at the Staples Center. Caption Threat at Oroville Dam slightly diminishes, but nearby areas still under evacuation order 
More than 100,000 people in communities downstream of Lake Oroville were told to evacuate Sunday evening after authorities grew concerned that dangerous flood waters would start surging out of the huge reservoir. 
More than 100,000 people in communities downstream of Lake Oroville were told to evacuate Sunday evening after authorities grew concerned that dangerous flood waters would start surging out of the huge reservoir. Caption 50th anniversary of the Black Cat demonstration 
On Feb. 11, 1967, they held a large, public gay-rights demonstration that pre-dated the famous Stonewall riots in New York City by two years. On Saturday night, people celebrated the 50th anniversary of the demonstration. 
On Feb. 11, 1967, they held a large, public gay-rights demonstration that pre-dated the famous Stonewall riots in New York City by two years. On Saturday night, people celebrated the 50th anniversary of the demonstration. Caption Steve Aoki: I'm proud to be nominated alongside Beyoncé and the Beatles 
Electronic music superstar Steve Aoki was nominated for a Grammy for best music film for the documentary "I'll Sleep When I'm Dead." 
Electronic music superstar Steve Aoki was nominated for a Grammy for best music film for the documentary "I'll Sleep When I'm Dead."
